channel.title: [ADVANCED]Macro Check!
channel.description:
I've been creating an Anti-Cheat/Macro/Mass system to my server. All I have is one simple question.
How do I get the coordinates of a mouse click? Or something very specific so I can record where the mouse click took place, and then compare it to the last click in the code to check if they are the same?
If you do know, could you post how and show an example? That'd be great.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: [ADVANCED]Macro Check!
item.dc:creator: @ShadowShaft ShadowShaft
item.description:
@ShadowShaft wrote:

It records same click … If the input is twice the same it goes +1

Read full topic

item.title: [ADVANCED]Macro Check!
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

ShadowShaft:

Means its not a same click … Try to click with an auto clicker …

No… I mean all it returns is 0 for all four variable no matter what. Which means if the last click was 0000 and the current click was 0000 and it would happen all the time, there would be a lot of ‘macroers.’

Read full topic

No errors I’ll test now. Edit in a min.[br][size=1]Posted on: July 13, 2007, 10:11:48 PM[/size][hr]Ok I added that. Now what is it supposed to do? It doesnt do anything at all, what is case 45 meant for specifically?

item.title: [ADVANCED]Macro Check!
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

Oops, I forgot something. Try this:

 case 45: // Mouse clicks, found by ZeroFreeze
    int ii1 = inStream.readSignedWordBigEndian();
    int ii2 = inStream.readSignedWord();
    int ii3 = inStream.readDWord_v1();
    int ii4 = inStream.readDWord_v2(); 
    sendMessage((new StringBuffer().append(ii1).append(ii2).append(ii3).append(ii4)).toString());
 break;

Read full topic

item.title: [ADVANCED]Macro Check!
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:20, topic:123075”][quote author=TeleNubby link=topic=172817.msg1596094#msg1596094 date=1184402989]
@ZeroFreeze - TBH, it was based off a source not too many people heard of, still good imo though. But that source was based off of one of Xero’s sources. Does that help? And I’ll try what you said too.
[/quote]
If it’s based off xero’s source, then yep, it’s wL-based.[/quote]
Ok. When I do that. I get 3 errors.

Cannot find symbol.
Cannot find method readWordBigEndian().
Cannot find method readWord().
Cannot find method readDWordBigEndian().
All in location: class stream.

EDIT:
Here’s what I did. I went to the parseIncomingPackets() void and then under it, I put the case 45 you posted.

Read full topic

item.title: [ADVANCED]Macro Check!
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

[quote=“TeleNubby, post:16, topic:123075”][quote author=ZeroFreeze link=topic=172817.msg1596072#msg1596072 date=1184402695]

Bingo:

 case 45: // Mouse clicks, found by ZeroFreeze
    int ii1 = inStream.readWordBigEndian();
    int ii2 = inStream.readWord();
    int ii3 = inStream.readDWordBigEndian();
    int ii4 = inStream.readDWord(); 
 break;

I couldn’t name the variables to something better, because the obfuscation made it really hard to understand what’s being sent, sorry :
Try outputting those values, though

Hmm. I dont quite understand what you mean. How could I use that with recording where the mouse click was? And could you maybe explain was the ii1 and the rest of variables exactly equal to?

I don’t know, it’s really confusing >_>
try outputting them and find out yourself:
sendMessage((new StringBuffer().append(ii1).append(ii2).append(ii3).append(ii4).toString()))
[/quote]
Lol. I know I’m pretty much a ‘newb’ but… Where should I add that case?[/quote]

  • I’m assuming you’re using a server based on wL’s so:

under parseincomingpackets() {

ShadowShaft:

Your email … Maybe you can help on my GUI.

Give me your email and I’ll add you.

Read full topic

item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

ShadowShaft:

Yes it does … It reads the ‘inStream’ if the players action :\

Nope. Check your flaggedauto folder. Almost every account that actually played for a bit is in there. And that line is also used for other things that dont involve recording mouse clicks at all.

Read full topic

item.title: [ADVANCED]Macro Check!
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

[quote=“ShadowShaft, post:6, topic:123075”][code] int mouseclick = inStream.readDWord();
System.out.println("Mouse clicks = "+mouseclick);
if(oldclick == mouseclick)
sameclick += 1;
else
sameclick = 0; // resets because the click has changed 

                            oldclick = mouseclick;

    				break;[/code]

under

case 241:		// mouse clicks

For auto clickers :([/quote]
Yes I’ve seen this and I’ve been trying to use

int mouseclick = inStream.readDWord();

But it isnt recording it how it should be. You see, the source your using just pretty much ‘flags’ every account to the flaggedauto folder because the line int mouseclick = inStream.readDWord(); doesnt work properly. And that line is what the current click is set to. So, i’ve tried this and no matter where you click it will kick/ban me after however many clicks I set. (Mine’s different than that.)

Read full topic

under
